issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: {{esi-manage-stack}} throws {{AttributeError}} while creating imaging worker instance, {noformat} [root@d-41 ~]# esi-manage-stack -a create imaging Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 142, in sm.enable(args.stack) File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 52, in enable state = self._get_stack_status(stack, False) File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 90, in _get_stack_status stacks = self._get_euform_conn(stack).describe_stacks() File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 73, in _get_euform_conn cloudform_url = urlparse(os.environ.get("AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL")) File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urlparse.py", line 132, in urlparse tuple = urlsplit(url, scheme, allow_fragments) File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urlparse.py", line 171, in urlsplit i = url.find(':') AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find' {noformat} *Update* [~zhill] and I went little further with the failure. Looks like the error in the description is due to not having AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL in the eucarc file. After re-downloading the admin creds zip file where AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL is populated properly, the {{esi-manage-stack}} command failed again with the following error, {noformat} [root@d-41 .euca]# esi-manage-stack -a create imaging euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown Error: failed to set property services.imaging.worker.configured to true To set it manually run this command: /usr/bin/euctl -U http://compute.e-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties services.imaging.worker.configured=true {noformat} When tried the recommended euctl command, {noformat} [root@d-41 ~]# euctl -U http://compute.e-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties services.imaging.worker.configured=true --debug 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 DEBUG Euctl parsed arguments: {'reset': False, 'show_defaults': False, 'security_token': None, 'dump': False, 'all_types': False, 'format': 'json', 'suppress_name': False, 'region': None, 'edit': False, 'prop_pairs': [('services.imaging.worker.configured', 'true')], 'url': 'http://compute.e-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties', 'show_descriptions': False, 'key_id': None, 'suppress_all': False, 'secret_key': None} 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config finding global option default-region 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config novalue for default-region 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config finding global option max-retries 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config novalue for max-retries 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config finding global option timeout 2015-09-17 01:29:21,574 INFO Config novalue for timeout 2015-09-17 01:29:21,575 DEBUG HmacV4Auth using auth info from environment 2015-09-17 01:29:21,575 INFO Euctl setting property value services.imaging.worker.configured: true 2015-09-17 01:29:21,576 DEBUG HmacV4Auth using auth info provided directly 2015-09-17 01:29:21,576 INFO ModifyPropertyValue parameters: {'Action': 'ModifyPropertyValue', 'Version': 'eucalyptus', 'Name': 'services.imaging.worker.configured', 'Value': 'true'} 2015-09-17 01:29:21,576 DEBUG ModifyPropertyValue sending flattened params as form data 2015-09-17 01:29:21,580 INFO Properties sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2015-09-17 01:29:21,588 DEBUG HmacV4Auth payload hash: 32b2c83e0b8d1bf78ab7b947d3d662065a7ffbc69c02aefeffb66355ee56b013 2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.3.4 requests/2.6.0 2015-09-17 01:29:21,590 DEBUG Properties request header: X-Amz-Content-SHA256: result: failure euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euctl", line 6, in eucalyptus_admin.commands.properties.euctl.Euctl.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 305, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 302, in run result self.handle_http_error(response) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucalyptus_admin/commands/properties/__init__.py", line 50, in handle_http_error raise AWSError(response) eucalyptus_admin.exceptions.AWSError: (404, 'Not Found', '404 Not Found', 'unknown') {noformat} Also tried using the latest clcadmin assume system cred, {noformat} [root@d-41 .euca]# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` [root@d-41 .euca]# esi-manage-stack -a create imaging euare-accountlist: error (403 Forbidden): Missing required parameter: AWSAccessKeyId euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown euare-accountlist: error (403 Forbidden): Missing required parameter: AWSAccessKeyId Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 142, in sm.enable(args.stack) File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 52, in enable state = self._get_stack_status(stack, False) File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 90, in _get_stack_status stacks = self._get_euform_conn(stack).describe_stacks() File "/usr/bin/esi-manage-stack", line 78, in _get_euform_conn system_accounts['(eucalyptus){0}'.format(stack)], KeyError: '(eucalyptus)imaging' {noformat} which probably due to EUCA-11378.

comments.body: I can change tool to WARN about missing URIs and still try to set property to kick off stack creation.

Let's fix the error to be more descriptive.

Meanwhile, [~shaon], would yo modify Calyptos to wait for the CloudFormation service to become enabled?

This fix failed.  Looks like its trying to use the EC2_URL with euctl to get property information.  
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# esi-manage-stack -a create imaging
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
Stack 'euca-internal-imaging-service' currently is in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state. Please wait till the end of previous stack change operation.
{code}
I tried to describe the service images, and the following message was returned:
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# esi-describe-images
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 166, in <module>
    ism.list(show_instances=args.show_instances)
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 80, in list
    if image.id == get_property('services.{0}.worker.image'.format(service)):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py", line 90, in get_property
    value = out.split()[-1]
IndexError: list index out of range
{code}
If you look at {{/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py}}, the get_property function:
{code}
def get_property(property):
    try:
        cmd = ['/usr/bin/euctl', '-U', _get_properties_url(), property]
        out = subprocess.Popen(cmd, env=os.environ.copy(), stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0]
        value = out.split()[-1]
        if value == "NULL":
            return None
        else:
            return value
    except OSError:
        print >> sys.stderr, "Error: failed to get property {0}.".format(property)
        sys.exit(1)
{code}
Because {{_get_properties_url()}} function uses EC2_URL:
{code}
def _get_properties_url():
    url = urlparse(os.environ.get("EC2_URL"))
    p = url.path.split('/')
    p[len(p)-1] = 'Properties'
    port = url.port if url.port else 80
    return "{0}://{1}:{2}{3}".format(url.scheme, url.hostname, port, '/'.join(p))
{code}
This can be viewed using the python debugger pdb:
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# esi-describe-images
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py(88)get_property()
-> try:
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py(89)get_property()
-> cmd = ['/usr/bin/euctl', '-U', _get_properties_url(), property]
(Pdb) p _get_properties_url()
'http://compute.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties'
(Pdb) p property
'services.imaging.worker.image'
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py(90)get_property()
-> out = subprocess.Popen(cmd, env=os.environ.copy(), stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0]
(Pdb) n
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py(91)get_property()
-> value = out.split()[-1]
(Pdb) p out.split()
[]
(Pdb) p out
''
{code}
The URL being used by euctl is not correct.  It should be {{http://compute.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Properties'}}.
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# euctl -U http://compute.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Properties  services.imaging.worker.image
services.imaging.worker.image = emi-eb429134
{code}

Eucalyptus Versions:
- {{eucalyptus-admin-tools.noarch                                                                    4.2.0-0.0.23913.667.20150924git57c7fca.el6}}
- {{eucalyptus-service-image.noarch                                                                  1.36-0.75.84.150925git68b5fe4.el6}}
- {{eucalyptus.x86_64                                                                                4.2.0-0.0.23913.667.20150924git57c7fca.el6}}
[~hspencer], what is wrong about using EC2_URL in this case? Do you have it set? If you don't this needs to be done until EUCA-10801 is fixed.

Due to this issue I cannot install new service images:

{code:java}
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# esi-install-image --install-default
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
Installing Service Image...
Found tarball /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.36.tar.xz
Decompressing tarball: /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image-1.36.tar.xz
Installing image from eucalyptus-service-image.raw
Bundling, uploading and registering image to bucket: eucalyptus-service-image-1.36
Registered image: emi-f4ae9d92
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
Error: failed to set property services.imaging.worker.image to emi-f4ae9d92
To set it manually run this command:
/usr/bin/euctl -U http://compute.scale1.qa2.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties services.imaging.worker.image=emi-f4ae9d92
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# euctl -U http://compute.scale1.qa2.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/Properties services.imaging.worker.image=emi-f4ae9d92
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# 
[root@scale-02-01-01 ~]# esi-describe-images 
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
euctl: error (404 Not Found): unknown
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 166, in <module>
    ism.list(show_instances=args.show_instances)
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 80, in list
    if image.id == get_property('services.{0}.worker.image'.format(service)):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/esitoolsupport/__init__.py", line 90, in get_property
    value = out.split()[-1]
IndexError: list index out of range
{code}
That URL is still wrong because it contains a DNS name for the compute service and a service path for the properties service.
[~gholms] what is correct URL for properties service in DNS enabled system?

[~vasya],

Should be something like 'properties.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com':
{code}
euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ nslookup properties.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Server:		10.1.1.254
Address:	10.1.1.254#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	properties.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.111.5.60

euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ nslookup compute.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Server:		10.1.1.254
Address:	10.1.1.254#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	compute.a-18.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.111.5.60
{code}
[~hspencer], could you re-test this? The new service instances with a fix for EUCA-10801 is out.
